alex.mojaki.boxes.observers.change

Class RequireBounds<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • alex.mojaki.boxes.observers.change.RequireBounds<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChangeObserver<Comparable<T>>

    public class RequireBounds<T>
extends Object
implements ChangeObserver<Comparable<T>>
    If the value is beyond the given bounds, or if it is equal to a bound that is not inclusive throw an IllegalArgumentException. For example: 

    
 PowerBox<Double> ratio = new CommonBox<>(Example.class, "ratio")
         .addChangeObserver(RequireBounds.between(0.0, false, 1.0, true));
                                                         ^           ^
                                                     exclusive   inclusive
 // Valid:
 ratio.set(0.5);
 ratio.set(1.0);

 // Invalid:
 ratio.set(-1.0);
 ratio.set(5.0);
 ratio.set(0.0);  // lower bound is exclusive

    You can specify two bounds with between, or a single bound with minimum or maximum.

      • onChange

        public void onChange(PowerBox<Comparable<T>> box,
                     Comparable<T> originalValue,
                     Comparable<T> finalValue,
                     Comparable<T> requestedValue)
        Description copied from interface: ChangeObserver
        Take some action based on the values involved in the change. Called when the value of a PowerBox changes for zero or more of these objects.
        Specified by:
        onChange in interface ChangeObserver<Comparable<T>>
        Parameters:
        box - the PowerBox whose value changed.
        originalValue - the value the box contained before the change.
        finalValue - the new value the box will have. In the case of PowerBox.set(Object), this is the final result of applying all ChangeMiddleware.
        requestedValue - the parameter of PowerBox.set(Object), or just the same as originalValue in the case of a mutation to a WrapperBox.
